message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a method for generating sequential decision-making policies directly from raw sensory input of all tasks and online evaluating the performance of system actions in discrete-time nonlinear systems. This involves the use of multi-task generative adversarial nets with shared memory for cross-domain coordination control. The paper focuses on the application of this method in collaborative factory automation, which falls under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), robotics (cs.RO), systems and control (cs.SY), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE).
